entry.title: Q A Expert Advice On Love Dating And Pandemic Relationships Consider This from NPR
entry.summary: We asked for your questions on navigating love and dating during the pandemic Therapist and sexologist Lexx Brown James has answers She s joined by Sam Sanders host of NPR s news and pop culture show It s Been A Minute Listen via Apple or Spotify And University of Georgia social scientist Dr Richard Slatcher shares some findings from his global research project Love In The Time Of COVID In participating regions you ll also hear a local news segment that will help you make sense of what s going on in your community Email us at considerthis npr org

entry.summary: In his closing remarks Michael van der Veen said Trump s words on the day of the Capitol insurrection were taken out of context and that any comments he did make are protected speech

entry.title: We Defended Our House Raskin Says After Trump Acquittal
entry.summary: Lead impeachment manager Rep Jamie Raskin and his team wrapped up their arguments Saturday Afterward he said Trump stormed our house with the mob he incited and we defended our house

entry.summary: In a statement issued shortly after a final vote in the Senate on a charge of inciting an insurrection Trump said the movement to Make America Great Again has only just begun

entry.summary: The Senate minority leader condemned the actions taken by Trump on the day of the Capitol insurrection but said he didn t believe the trial was constitutional

entry.title: Senate Acquits Trump In Impeachment Trial Again

entry.title: Republican Acquittal of Trump Is a Pivotal Moment for the Party
entry.summary: The vote signaling how thoroughly the party has come to be defined by the personality of one man is likely to leave a blemish on the historical record

entry.title: Video Trump Acquitted of Inciting Insurrection
entry.summary: The Senate voted to acquit former president Donald J Trump of the incitement of insurrection charge in the deadly riot at the Capitol with 57 guilty votes 10 shy of the number necessary to convict the former president

entry.title: Video McConnell Votes to Acquit but Rebukes Trump
entry.summary: Senator Mitch McConnell the minority leader said that former President Donald J Trump was practically and morally responsible for the Jan 6 attack on the Capitol but that he was not technically eligible to be impeached

entry.title: Here are the seven Republicans who voted to convict Trump

entry.title: Takeaways From Day 5 of Trump s Impeachment Trial

entry.title: Impeachment Briefing The Senate Acquits Trump
entry.summary: The Senate voted 57 43 in favor of convicting him not enough to meet the required two thirds majority

entry.summary: Black Americans are getting vaccinated at lower rates than whites A new push to send vaccines to community health centers is intended to help quickly bridge that gap

entry.title: Biden Announces Deal For 200 Million More COVID 19 Vaccines
entry.summary: We ve now purchased enough vaccine supplies to vaccinate all Americans Biden said on Thursday Now we re working to get those vaccines into the arms of millions of people

entry.title: Australian Open Bans Spectators As State Enters 5 Day Lockdown
entry.summary: Officials in Victoria imposed a snap lockdown after several new cases of the highly contagious U K variant of the coronavirus were discovered

entry.title: Why Biden Looks To Mayors To Help Make The Case For More COVID 19 Aid
entry.summary: President Biden hasn t yet secured support from congressional Republicans for his 1 9 trillion COVID 19 aid plan but he s touting bipartisan support from state and local officials

entry.title: People With Intellectual Disabilities Are Often Overlooked In Pandemic Response
entry.summary: Without federal tracking no one knows how many people in disability group housing have fallen ill or died from the virus And few states are prioritizing them for vaccination

entry.title: Oxygen Industry Scrambles To Keep U S Patients With COVID 19 Breathing
entry.summary: Supply shortages of oxygen for hospitals have plagued many countries but the U S has averted the most dire partly because the industry figured out new ways to share resources and anticipate needs

entry.title: Third Vaccine On The Way Fauci Hails Spectacular Results Consider This from NPR
entry.summary: A third COVID 19 vaccine could receive emergency use authorization from the Food and Drug Administration this month The vaccine made by Johnson amp Johnson is 66 effective in preventing moderate to severe disease according to a global study Combined with the two vaccines currently in circulation the U S could have three vaccines that are all highly effective at preventing death or hospitalization due to COVID 19 Despite that promising news NPR s Richard Harris reports on why the journey to herd immunity still won t be easy And Rae Ellen Bichelle goes inside a Colorado long term care facility that has vaccinated nearly all of its residents They say the initial steps to a return to normalcy feel great Additional reporting in this episode on the spread of coronavirus variants from NPR s Allison Aubrey In participating regions you ll also hear a local news segment that will help you make sense of what s going on in your community Email us at considerthis npr org

entry.title: Biden Promises To Grapple With Environmental Racism Short Wave
entry.summary: People of color experience more air and water pollution than white people and suffer the health impacts The federal government helped create the problem and has largely failed to fix it NPR climate reporter Rebecca Hersher talks about the history of environmental racism in the United States and what Biden s administration can do to avoid the mistakes of the past Read Rebecca s reporting on how Biden hopes to address the environmental impacts of systemic racism Email the show at shortwave npr org

entry.title: Dr Fauci On Vaccinations And Biden s Refreshing Approach To COVID 19
entry.summary: The administration is in its early days but the infectious disease expert says he s encouraged by the new president s attitude about the pandemic Science Fauci says is going to rule

entry.title: It Takes Time TED Radio Hour
entry.summary: We live in an era of instant gratification But some things to reach their full potential simply cannot be rushed This hour TED speakers explore what we can learn from ideas that take time Guests include zoologist Lucy Cooke neuroscientist Matthew Walker architect Julia Watson and NASA engineer Nagin Cox

entry.title: Johnson Johnson Applies For Emergency Use Authorization For COVID 19 Vaccine
entry.summary: The company s vaccine has shown to be 85 effective against severe forms of the disease Patients will only need to receive one shot instead of two as with other vaccines already in use in the U S

entry.title: Lucy Cooke How Did Slowness Become The Sloth s Secret To Survival
entry.summary: It s easy to see why sloths have become icons of laziness But zoologist Lucy Cooke says behind their leisurely pace is a marvelous evolutionary advantage that is the secret to their survival

entry.title: Matthew Walker Why Is It Essential To Make Time For Sleep
entry.summary: Sleep is crucial for our health and there are alarming consequences when we don t get enough Matthew Walker explores the many benefits of a full night of sleep and how to make sleep a priority

entry.title: Africa s Hit Science Show For Kids Is Coming To The U S
entry.summary: African TV execs say it s unlike any show for kids that s been produced and broadcast on the continent especially with its focus on women presenters and scientists

entry.title: Hope Heads For A Rendezvous With Mars
entry.summary: The UAE probe arrives at Mars on Tuesday Feb 9 Its purpose is to both study the weather on Mars as well as inspire the next generation of that country s scientists and engineers

entry.title: My Mother Got Vaccinated Is It Now Safe To Visit
entry.summary: I haven t seen my mother in over a year I was going to visit in April to celebrate her 90th birthday but the pandemic put that on hold Now that she s been vaccinated is it time for the birthday hug

entry.title: Under A White Sky Examines What It Might Take For Humans To Continue To Exist
entry.summary: Elizabeth Kolbert makes clear how far we already are from a world of undisturbed balanced nature and how far we must go to find a new balance for the planet s future one that still includes us

entry.title: Elon Musk Funds 100 Million XPrize For Pursuit Of New Carbon Removal Ideas
entry.summary: The goal XPrize says is to tackle the biggest threat facing humanity fighting climate change and rebalancing Earth s carbon cycle

entry.title: 8 Year Old Calls Out NPR For Lack Of Dinosaur Stories
entry.summary: How can All Things Considered consider all things without considering dinosaurs That s the question posed by 8 year old Leo Shidla of Minneapolis

entry.title: Why 500 000 COVID 19 Deaths May Not Feel Any Different Short Wave
entry.summary: Why is it so hard to feel the difference between 400 000 and 500 000 COVID 19 deaths and how might that impact our decision making during the pandemic Psychologist Paul Slovic explains the concept of psychic numbing and how humans can often use emotion rather than statistics to make decisions about risk Email the show at shortwave npr org

entry.title: Short On Special Syringes Japan May Waste Millions Of Pfizer Vaccine Doses
entry.summary: Japan had purchased doses to vaccinate 72 million people but without the appropriate syringes it will fall 12 million people short

entry.title: When Defending The Land Puts Your Own Life At Risk Short Wave
entry.summary: Global Witness documented that 212 environmental and land activists were murdered in 2019 Over half of those documented murders took place in Colombia and the Philippines countries where intensive mining and agribusiness has transformed the environment NPR Short Wave reporter Emily Kwong speaks with three activists about the intersection between natural resource extraction and violence and what keeps them going in their work

entry.title: Birds Chocolate Scorpions Happy Valentine s Day Short Wave
entry.summary: Happy Valentine s Day from Short Wave We ve got something special for the holiday Maddie and Emily exchange the gift of science facts from the process of farming and fermenting cacao to the courtship rituals of scorpions and loggerhead shrikes Email the show at shortwave npr org

entry.title: Saving Sea Level Records What Historical Records Tell Us About The Rising Ocean Short Wave
entry.summary: Archival records may help researchers figure out how fast the sea level is rising in certain places Millions of people in coastal cities are vulnerable to rising sea levels and knowing exactly how fast the water is rising is really important But it s a tough scientific question NPR climate correspondent Lauren Sommer explains how scientists are looking to historical records to help get at the answer For more of Lauren s reporting follow her on Twitter lesommer Email us at ShortWave npr org

entry.title: Minibrains With A Neanderthal Gene Offer Hints About Human Evolution
entry.summary: When researchers inserted an ancient gene into lab grown brainlike organoids they began to look and behave differently The experiments help show how the human brain has evolved

entry.title: Jeff Bezos To Step Down As Amazon s CEO
entry.summary: Amazon s CEO will be Andy Jassy the head of its cloud computing division As much as I still tap dance into the office I m excited about this transition Bezos says

entry.title: Parler CEO Is Fired After Constant Resistance Inside The Conservative Friendly Site
entry.summary: John Matze was ousted as the social media company struggles to find a way back online with Big Tech companies cracking down on the site after the riot at the Capitol

entry.title: Robinhood s Very Bad Day Planet Money
entry.summary: How the stock trading app works And why it almost broke last week Subscribe to our weekly newsletter here

entry.title: Just Cruel Digital Race For COVID 19 Vaccines Leaves Many Seniors Behind
entry.summary: Glitchy websites jammed phone lines and long lines outside clinics are complicating the vaccine rollout And older Americans and those without caregivers and computer skills are at a disadvantage

entry.title: Ken Griffin The Hedge Fund Titan In The Middle Of The Reddit Investing Revolt
entry.summary: Ken Griffin s investment firm Citadel became embedded in the in GameStop trading controversy Citadel has a hand in nearly every corner of the financial system

entry.title: Nagin Cox What Does Time On Mars Teach Us About Time On Earth
entry.summary: NASA engineer Nagin Cox lives on Earth but works on Mars time where days are longer and time works differently Her work with the rovers has entirely changed the way she thinks about time on Earth

entry.title: Why QAnon Survives After Trump
entry.summary: Travis View hosts the conspiracy debunking podcast QAnon Anonymous He says QAnon persists because its delusional ideas don t come from a single leader but are self generated and crowdsourced

entry.title: In Alabama Workers At Amazon Warehouse Are Poised For Union Vote
entry.summary: Some 5 800 workers at the Bessemer facility will vote starting this week on joining the Retail Wholesale and Department Store Union potentially making it Amazon s first union shop in the U S

entry.title: Myanmar Blocks Facebook Twitter As Anti Coup Protests Grow
entry.summary: Days after a coup and the detention of Aung San Suu Kyi and other elected leaders the country s military is moving to strangle free speech by shutting down access to social media sites

entry.title: Facebook Widens Ban On COVID 19 Vaccine Misinformation In Push To Boost Confidence
entry.summary: The social network says it will focus on groups pages and accounts repeatedly sharing false claims about vaccines

entry.title: What s In A Tattoo Scientists Are Looking For Answers Short Wave
entry.summary: Three in 10 people in America have a tattoo and those in the 18 34 age bracket it s almost 40 percent But what s in those inks exactly NPR science correspondent Nell Greenfieldboyce talks about what researchers currently know about tattoo inks It s not a lot and researchers are trying to find out more Email the show at ShortWave npr org

entry.title: FBI Called In After Hacker Tries To Poison Tampa Area City s Water With Lye
entry.summary: The hacker changed the sodium hydroxide from about 100 parts per million to 11 100 parts per million Pinellas County Sheriff Bob Gualtieri said

entry.title: WHO Is Fighting False COVID Info On Social Media How s That Going
entry.summary: A year ago the World Health Organization declared war on misinformation by partnering with Big Tech from Facebook to Twitter to Uber They re sending out public health messages Who s tuning in

entry.title: Sisters With Transistors Pioneers Of Electronic Music
entry.summary: The new documentary tells the story of the roles women played and continue to play in the creation and development of electronic music from theremin virtuoso Clara Rockmore to today

entry.title: Electronic Health Records May Be Delaying COVID 19 Vaccinations
entry.summary: The same electronic systems used to record when patients get a physical or go to the ER are also used to log data when coronavirus vaccines are given But the systems don t share information easily

entry.title: U S Cyber Weapons Were Leaked And Are Now Being Used Against Us Reporter Says
entry.summary: New York Times reporter Nicole Perlroth says the U S went from having the world s strongest cyber arsenal to becoming most susceptible to attack Her book is This is How They Tell Me The World Ends

entry.title: Why A Musician Breathed New Life Into A 17 000 Year Old Conch Shell Horn
entry.summary: A seashell found in a French cave appears to have been modified by prehistoric people so that it could be used like a trumpet making it a new addition to the Stone Age orchestra

entry.title: Instagram Bars Robert F Kennedy Jr For Spreading Vaccine Misinformation
entry.summary: We removed this account for repeatedly sharing debunked claims about the coronavirus or vaccines says a spokesperson for Facebook which owns Instagram

entry.summary: Everyone enjoys a good laugh but could humor be the secret to success in the workplace

entry.title: Lex Luthor Of The Internet Meet The Man Keeping Far Right Websites Alive
entry.summary: Rob Monster the chief executive of Epik says his company s deals with websites Parler Gab BitChute and others is an act of free speech advocacy Others say Epik is supporting hate speech

entry.title: The Game Is Rigged How Fury Over The Great Recession Fueled The Reddit Trade
entry.summary: The GameStop stock saga has risen into a movement fueled by a wave of emotions from the 2008 global financial crisis that are still raw

entry.title: After GameStop A Better Way To Take On Wall Street
entry.summary: Taxes may lack the razzle dazzle of meme fueled stock rallies But they might prove a better way to curb Wall Street excesses

entry.title: Fox News Asks Court To Dismiss 2 7 Billion Defamation Suit
entry.summary: Smartmatic an election technology company sued the network for its disinformation campaign waged by people unhappy with President Biden s election victory

entry.summary: Aunt Jemima and other food brands such as Uncle Ben s announced a redesign following protests against systemic racism and police brutality in the U S last summer

entry.summary: Dogecoin a cryptocurrency created in 2013 as a joke recently broke a 10 billion market cap The coin s creator tells us how the joke became real and if he has regrets

entry.summary: The Biden administration is expected to be sued over its ban on new oil and gas leasing on federal land In top fossil fuel states like Wyoming cuts to services and mass layoffs were already looming

entry.title: Twitter s Birdwatch Aims to Crowdsource Fight Against Misinformation
entry.summary: Twitter is turning to its users to help find and flag misinformation with a new pilot program called Birdwatch combining crowdsourcing and consensus

entry.title: Forget Ride Hailing Uber Wants To Be Your One Stop Shop For Everything
entry.summary: During the pandemic Uber has doubled down on delivery services while its ride hailing business plummeted The strategy appears to be working so well it could outlast the health crisis

entry.title: Can t Let It Go Planet Money
entry.summary: Irrational decisions Things we can t let go Friend of the show Sam Sanders comes by to talk obsessions We turn to economics for advice clarity and comfort Subscribe to Sam s podcast It s Been A Minute

entry.title: China U S Trade Agreement Fail The Indicator from Planet Money
entry.summary: Last year China pledged to vastly increase its U S imports during 2020 and 2021 We ask economist Chad Bown if actual spending has been keeping pace with what was promised

entry.title: Biden Administration Pauses Trump s TikTok Ban Backs Off Pressure To Sell App
entry.summary: TikTok will still undergo a national security review by federal officials but any outright ban or pressure to sell to an American company will not be a priority of the Biden White House

entry.title: Clubhouse May Be Social Media s Future What s All The Hype About

entry.title: Federal Budget Deficit Expected To Hit Second Largest Since World War II

entry.title: Small Local Banks Make A Big Difference For Black Owned Businesses Trying To Hang On
entry.summary: Black owned businesses were often at the back of the line when the first coronavirus relief loans were doled out Now some are turning to banks that specialize in minority firms for help

entry.title: Scenes From A Pandemic Economy 4 American Indicators Consider This from NPR
entry.summary: The pandemic economy has left different people in vastly different situations Today we introduce four American indicators people whose paths will help us understand the arc of the recovery Hear their stories now and we ll follow up with them in a few months Brooke Neubauer in Nevada founder of The Just One Project Lisa Winton of the Winton Machine Company in Georgia Lee Camp with Arch City Defenders in Missouri and New Jersey based hotel owner Bhavish Patel In participating regions you ll also hear a local news segment that will help you make sense of what s going on in your community Email us at considerthis npr org

entry.title: U S Stands With The People Imposes Sanctions On Myanmar s Coup Leaders
